intro: Erigeron nematophylloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to North America and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and often have a silvery or grayish hue due to a dense covering of fine hairs. Erigeron nematophylloides is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and is often used in native plant gardens.
